publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-809# Elaine Smith: Right to Respite—That the Parliament notes National Carers Week 2000 between 12 and 18 June; recognises the outstanding contribution made by thousands of Scots, including a great many constituents in Coatbridge and Chryston, who provide care for sick or disabled family or friends; notes the on-going commitment by the Scottish Executive to assist those who find themselves in a caring role; notes the difficulties encountered with the provision of respite care to carers and the cared for, and believes that a "Right to Respite" should be enshrined for all. Supported by: Rhoda Grant*

S1M-809# Elaine Smith: Right to Respite—That the Parliament notes National Carers Week 2000 between 12 and 18 June; recognises the outstanding contribution made by thousands of Scots, including a great many constituents in Coatbridge and Chryston, who provide care for sick or disabled family or friends; notes the on-going commitment by the Scottish Executive to assist those who find themselves in a caring role; notes the difficulties encountered with the provision of respite care to carers and the cared for, and believes that a "Right to Respite" should be enshrined for all. Supported by: Rhoda Grant, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Michael Russell*
S1M-809# Right to Respite (lodged on 4 May 2000) Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-809# Right to Respite (lodged on 4 May 2000) Shona Robison*, Dr Elaine Murray*
S1M-809# Right to Respite (lodged on 4 May 2000) Nora Radcliffe*, Christine Grahame*, Tommy Sheridan*, Margaret Jamieson*
S1M-809# Right to Respite (lodged on 4 May 2000) Donald Gorrie*, Alex Neil*, Mr John McAllion*, Andrew Wilson*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*

Supported by: Rhoda Grant, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Mr Jamie Stone, Michael Russell, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Shona Robison, Dr Elaine Murray, Nora Radcliffe, Christine Grahame, Tommy Sheridan, Margaret Jamieson, Donald Gorrie, Alex Neil, Mr John McAllion, Andrew Wilson, Mr Duncan Hamilton

S1M-809# Right to Respite (lodged on 4 May 2000) Irene McGugan*
